newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat turns lower as CBOT, KCBT drop.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat turns lower as CBOT, KCBT drop.

text.p: Disappointing weekly exports and fund selling in the CBOT and KCBT markets pressed MGE spring wheat futures lower near midday, traders said.
USDA early Thursday said for the week ended January 9 U.S. net export sales of wheat totaled 177,500 tonnes, below expectations for 200,000 to 400,000 tonnes.
The downturn occurred after the market was buoyed early by harsh winter weather in the U.S. which is slowing movement of wheat and boosting spot cash basis markets, traders said.
Cash spring wheat merchandisers late Wednesday said nothing was moving because of the weather.
Commercial buying early was noted with Continental Grain a key purchaser of 500,000 bushels of March, traders said.
"Continental bought 500 March which probably was hedging of the Japanese business overnight," a trader said. Japan bought 40,000 tonnes of U.S. dark northern spring overnight.
At 1137 CST, MGE spring wheat futures were 1-1/4 to 3-3/4 cents per bushel lower, with March down 3-3/4 at $3.91-3/4.
